channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: SolarWinds hackers breach new victims, including a Microsoft support agent
item.description: Discovery came as Microsoft was investigating new breaches by the same hacker group.

item.title: All the major players spent time in the Denisovan cave
item.description: Even the sediment in the floor of Denisova Cave has a story to tell.

item.title: Circling—or cycling—the track at F1’s famous Circuit of the Americas
item.description: Be warned: Calves needed to climb all 133 feet of Turn 1 if you’re using a road bike.

item.title: A well-meaning feature leaves millions of Dell PCs vulnerable
item.description: Firmware security tool flaws affect as many as 30M desktops, laptops, and tablets.

item.title: Even mild COVID in young people often leads to long-term symptoms, study finds
item.description: Common symptoms among young adults included fatigue and cognitive problems.

item.title: We have our best look yet at supervillain Mandarin in new Shang-Chi trailer
item.description: “Throughout my life, the Ten Rings gave my family power.”

item.title: Here’s how Android apps on Windows 11 are going to work
item.description: Microsoft is building an Android framework on top of the Windows Subsystem for Linux.

item.title: Biden silent on municipal broadband as he makes $65B deal with Republicans
item.description: No word yet, but GOP likely wouldn’t agree to deal if it favored public networks.

item.title: Here’s what you’ll need to upgrade to Windows 11
item.description: The TPM requirement has many Windows 10 users worried—often unnecessarily.

item.title: NFC flaws let researchers hack an ATM by waving a phone
item.description: Flaws in card-reader technology can wreak havoc with point-of-sale systems and more.

item.title: Cold-case files: Archaeologists discover 3,000-year-old victim of shark attack
item.description: Young adult male lost an arm and a leg before dying of shock and blood loss.

item.title: Competition watchdog to probe Google and Amazon over fake reviews
item.description: UK regulators say tech groups may not be doing enough to protect consumers.

item.title: Rocket Report: China to copy SpaceX’s Super Heavy? Vulcan slips to 2022
item.description: “We saw something we didn’t understand and didn’t expect to happen.”

item.title: Google to Android devs: Support more form factors, get a higher sales cut
item.description: Google entices multimillion-dollar media apps with a 15 percent Play Store fee.

item.title: Here’s all the data on myocarditis cases linked to COVID-19 vaccines
item.description: Experts stress the need for everyone to get vaccinated as the Delta variant spreads.

item.title: “I’m totally screwed.” WD My Book Live users wake up to find their data deleted
item.description: Storage-device maker advises customers to unplug My Book Lives from the Internet ASAP.

item.title: The human family tree keeps getting more complicated
item.description: Newly described bones have a mix of Neanderthal and older features.

item.title: House committee approves bill that could break up Amazon, Apple, and Google
item.description: Judiciary Committee takes on Big Tech, but full House and Senate votes remain.

item.title: Hackers are using unknown user accounts to target Zyxel firewalls and VPNs
item.description: Authentication bypass attacks allow hackers to change breach network security.

item.title: Google delays FLoC rollout until 2023
item.description: With regulators, privacy advocates, and major websites condemning FLoC, Google relents.

item.title: DirectStorage on Windows 11: Next-gen gaming performance, with PC requirements
item.description: Here’s what you’ll need to get some (but not all) of Series X’s jumps on a Win11 PC.

item.title: Review: Omar Sy shines brighter than ever as gentleman thief in Lupin Part 2
item.description: Surprise Netflix hit is based on character created by French novelist Maurice LeBlanc.

item.title: Windows 11 is much more than a new theme slapped onto Windows 10
item.description: Windows 11 should be a free upgrade for most licensed Windows 10 users.

item.title: Hyundai’s 2022 Tucson Hybrid is a charming and efficient crossover
item.description: There’s a lot to like about this 38 mpg crossover, which starts at under $30,000.

item.title: Fast 9 film review: Fast and furious enough, but buckle up for potholes
item.description: An explosive excuse to return to theaters, even if it misses some of the F�F point.

item.title: A quick-start guide to OpenZFS native encryption
item.description: Learn the hows, whys, and whats of OpenZFS encryption with this short guide.

item.title: Physicists show that flying beer coasters will flip 0.45 seconds into flight
item.description: Without the frisbee’s rounded edges, beer mats flip onto their side with a backspin.

item.title: Supreme Court backs cheerleader over school that punished her for Snapchat post
item.description: HS violated First Amendment when it kicked cheerleader off junior varsity team.

item.title: AV mogul John McAfee found dead by hanging in Spanish prison cell
item.description: McAFee’s larger-than-life and often illegal antics came to define his later years.

item.title: Apple exec: “Sideloading in this case is actually eliminating choice”
item.description: Facing legal actions, Apple argues on the basis of privacy, security.

item.title: Who could know we’re here on Earth?
item.description: A survey of nearby bodies reveals a lot of stars from which Earth is detectable.

item.title: Altice is reducing cable-Internet upload speeds by up to 86% next month
item.description: Altice cuts uploads from 35Mbps to 5Mbps to bring them “in line with other ISPs.”

item.title: A quick roundup of the best Prime Day 2021 deals that are still available
item.description: Dealmaster has deals on the MacBook Air, Xbox Game Pass, Nest gear, and more.

item.title: NASA chief reminds Congress they’re the ones not funding a lunar lander
item.description: “You can only get so many pounds of potatoes out of a five-pound sack.”

item.title: US seizes 33 Iranian state-run media sites accused of election disinformation
item.description: Iranian news group ran disinformation campaigns to mislead US voters, US says.

item.title: Fight over hospital’s COVID-19 vaccine mandate ends with 153 workers out of a job
item.description: Nurse who led the fight reportedly has a new job treating people inside their homes.

item.title: The Nokia G20 comes to the US for $199, packs a “3-day” battery life
item.description: It has a Mediatek G35 SoC and 5050 mAh battery, comes with 2 years of updates.

item.title: Ahoy, there’s malice in your repos—PyPI is the latest to be abused
item.description: Open source repositories can be vectors for maliciousness, so look before you run.

item.title: Google Photos is so 2020—welcome to the world of self-hosted photo management
item.description: Google offers many desirable, easy-to-use, effective features. Going open source is trickier.

item.title: 24,000 years on ice weren’t enough to kill these gals
item.description: Ancient species may re-enter the ecosystem as the world’s permafrost thaws.

item.title: Climate-driven coastal flooding in the US likely to get worse suddenly
item.description: Within a few decades, many areas of the US may see a rapid change in frequency.

item.title: Xbox cloud upgrade is live: Series X power on your browser for over 260 games
item.description: Game Pass Ultimate’s $15/mo now goes a lot further, and we break down why.

item.title: Once-dreaded Alpha variant is falling fast—Delta and Gamma take over
item.description: The Delta coronavirus variant now accounts for 20.6 percent of cases in the US.

item.title: The “loser, B-grade supervillains” are back in new The Suicide Squad trailer
item.description: “Your mission is to destroy every trace of something known only as Project Starfish.”

item.title: Amazon Prime Day 2021: All the deals that are actually worth your time [Day 2 Update]
item.description: We’ve dug through piles of Prime Day garbage to find the gear worth considering.

item.title: SiFive’s brand-new P550 is one of the world’s fastest RISC-V CPUs
item.description: Today’s RISC-V microcontrollers may lead to future RISC-V phones and laptops.

item.title: A week after arrests, Cl0p ransomware group dumps new tranche of stolen data
item.description: Leak shows that, like the rest of the ransomware scourge, Cl0p isn’t going away.

item.title: The OnePlus 8 for $349 is the best Prime Day smartphone deal
item.description: You can get a phone with 2020 flagship specs and a 90 Hz display for under $400.

item.title: Marvel’s Avengers update flashes IP addresses on screen, dev promises fix
item.description: Bad news if you’re a Twitch streamer on PS5, though dev says fix is incoming.

item.title: Boston Dynamics is officially part of Hyundai Motor Group
item.description: Car manufacturing expertise could supercharge Boston Dynamics' commercial hopes.

item.title: EU launches antitrust probe into Google banning third-party cookies in Chrome
item.description: EC says Google hiding user data from advertisers may violate competition rules.

item.title: These are the 9 worst states to buy an electric car in
item.description: Unsurprisingly, EV accessibility is unevenly distributed across the country.

item.title: Monero emerges as crypto of choice for cybercriminals
item.description: Untraceable “privacy coin” is rising in popularity among ransomware gangs.

item.title: Congress isn’t happy about SpaceX’s lunar lander and may vent this week
item.description: “I would simply say, Congress supports SLS and Orion.”
